deck: Callum Israel  is the main protagonist in the ongoing series The Massive. Callum is the captain of the Ninth Wave conservationist vessel the Kapital.
description:
Callum Israel was born in Bangladesh in 1966.

On New Year's Day in 1995, he was a specialist for Blackbell PMC a multinational security contractor which had been tasked with handling a group of environmental activists who had commandeered an oil drilling platform off the coast of Norway.

During the raid, an unprecedented series of "rogue waves" smashed into the oil platform. Callum states that he lost count at seven "rogue waves". He is thought to be the only survivor.

This event led Israel to reconsider his association with Blackbell PMC and for six years he has sought the activist organization which had taken over the oil rig.

Arkady Sirilov is an American of Ukranian heritage born in Brighton Beach, New York. He thrived as an operative for Blackbell PMC.

He and Callum Israel were partners in many operations but had a falling out over the assassination of a civilian during an op in Slovenia.

Currently Arkady is working in Mogadishu within the black market. He made a proposal to Callum for them to renew their partnership which Callum refused. Arkady has made it known that he covets the Kapital.

deck: The strongest of the Warriors of the Thousand Galaxies.
description:
Origin

Brok the Crusher is a member of the Warriors of the Thousand Galaxies, alongside his brothers Drom the Spirit Weaver, Tyr of the Blinding Blade, and Galp of the Steel Arm. The All Father of Asgard Odin plans to hold a Tournament of Titans, the warrior blood brothers step forward to prove themselves. The brothers start a brawl in an Asgardian tavern and proceed to mock the Asgardians, however they would find themselves face to face with the Warriors Three and Thor after that incident, their official opponents at the Tournament of the Titans. After a small scuffle they decide to wait until the tournament to settle things, however on the day of the Tournament the devastating Destroyer armor attacks all the combatants, the two teams of warriors joining forces with Odin to bring the living armor down. During the tournament, Brok challenged Thor as he was the strongest. 

Creation

Brok the Crusher is a Marvel comic book character created by Stan Lee, Jack Kirby and Vince Colletta. The character first appears in Thor Annual #2 released in 1966.
name: Brok the Crusher

teams.name: The Warriors of the Thousand Galaxies

deck: The smallest of the Warriors of the Thousand Galaxies.
name: Drom the Spirit Weaver

teams.name: The Warriors of the Thousand Galaxies

deck: A member of the Warriors of the Thousand Galaxies. Galp wields a blunt mace.
name: Galp of the Steel Arm

teams.name: The Warriors of the Thousand Galaxies

deck: A member of the Warriors of the the Thousand Galaxies. Is armed with a sword.
description:
Origin 

Tyr of the Blinding Blade is a member of the Warriors of the Thousand Galaxies, brothers who specialties with weapons vary.  When the All Father Odin decides to hold the Tournament of Titans, it requires mighty warriors to participate in the event, and Tyr along with his fellow brothers, Brok the Crusher, Drom the Spirit Weaver, and Galp of the Steel Arm. Prior to the tournament the brothers start a brawl in an Asgardian tavern and proceed to mock the Asgardians, however they would find themselves face to face with the Warriors Three and Thor after that incident, their official opponents at the Tournament of the Titans. After a small scuffle they decide to wait until the tournament to settle things, however on the day of the Tournament the devastating Destroyer armor attacks all the combatants, the two teams of warriors joining forces with Odin to bring the living armor down. During the tournament, Brok challenged Thor as he was the strongest, Tyr dueled with Fandral, as both were sword masters. Galp challenged Hogun, as both bore lethal mace clubs. Which left Drom and Volstagg to do battle. 

Creation

Tyr of the Blinding Blade is Marvel comic book team created by Stan Lee, Jack Kirby and Vince Colletta. The team first appear in Thor Annual #2 released in 1966. The team possess parallel similarities with the Warriors Three, naturally given they were essentially created to act as a foe for each character, specifically Galp for Hogun, Tyr for Fandral and Drom for Volstagg. It should be noted that the Tyr here is not in anyway associated with the Asgardian war god Tyr.

Powers and Abilities

Tyr of the Blinding Blade is a skilled and powerful swordsman.
name: Tyr of the Blinding Blade

teams.name: The Warriors of the Thousand Galaxies

deck: A robotic duplicate of Tails and a member of the Metal Series.

deck: A robotic duplicate of Knuckles and a member of the Metal Series.
description:
Origin

Metal Knuckles is a robotic version of Knuckles, similar to Knuckles. You have to collect 5 Sonic Tokens in the Reactive Factory in order to unlock this specific character, then beat him in a one-on-one race. Eggman prepared this secret weapon for the sake of overthrowing Knuckles, considering his existence to be a hindrance. Having the same power plant as Metal Sonic , speed and acceleration power are high, but like Knuckles, this robot can glide from high places.

Current Events

Metal Knuckles sometimes appears in Sonic comic books, video games, and other media as a member of the Metal versions/enemies/counterparts of the original Sonic crew.

Powers & Abilities

Knuckles is extremely fast, although not as fast as (Metal)Sonic, makes up for his superior brute strength, short claws and aggressiveness. He also has robotic upgrades that enable him to fly for vast distances, unlike his fleshy counterparts.

deck: Alexander Dorian is a member of the alien race The Vine. He was born and raised on Earth and is a genetically modified alien who looks human.
description:
Origin

In 402 A.D., members of the alien race The Vine arrived on Earth. They left behind genetically modified offspring that look human. In time these hybrid members of The Vine found each other and began increasing their numbers. Alexander Dorian is one of the new generation of Vine who were born on Earth. Being used to the luxuries of life on this planet, when Dorian discovered a Vine invasion was on its way to destroy Earth, he became a traitor to his own race and made an alliance with X-O Manowar and Ninjak to save our world.

Creation

Alexander Dorian was created by writer Robert Venditti and artist Cary Nord. He first appeared in the story "Then and Now" in X-O Manowar #4 (Aug. 2012).

issue_credits.name: The Kill List Part 2: Going To Ground
The Kill List Part 1: Kill List

deck: Writer with some skills, he's basically got a crazy mind and often his fantasies get so intense to become real (or almost) and influence the reality around him.
description:
Young Brian Lazarus.

First met when he self-retired into an abandoned decaying mental hospital in the swamps around Citrusville (Florida), Brian was composing his 'opera summa' but risked his life as his crazy fantasies were becoming real and trying to kill him. Surviving the maddening ordeal, he went into cure and finally decided to move to California, and taking a normal life, he became a popular writer working for game-shows and cartoons for children.

Eventually, he got married to Linda and had a child, Jason Lazarus.

But after many years, when the crysis arrived, he realized that his "real life" was all a facade, so decided to leave evrything behind him and escape again back to the first asylum in the swamps, where tried to bring to an end all his dreams, fantasies, and fears.

Character History

Amazon Queen of Cuzco, the Ancient Land of Pleasures.

Madame Elisabeth and the other inhabitants of the Route des Maisons Roug travel to Cuzco because they believe that Halima controls a magical potion that bestows pleasure on those who drink it. However, Halima explains to them that the pleasure in Cuczo stems from its political system, in which all the local regents cooperate with each other.

deck: Admiral Xylem is an alien military leader. He was Admiral on the ship that kidnapped X-O Manowar and is leading The Vine's invasion of Earth.
description:
Origin

Admiral Xylem is a military leader for the alien race The Vine. He is the Admiral of the mother ship that kidnapped Aric of Dacia and Gafti from their homes. He is leading The Vine invasion of Earth.

Creation

Admiral Xylem was created by writer Robert Venditti and artist Cary Nord. He first appeared in the story "The Road to Rome" in X-O Manowar #3 (Jul. 2012).

Major Story Arcs

Admiral Xylem was leading The Vine invasion of Earth in order to retrieve, or destroy, Shanhara (the X-O Manowar Armour). His fleet were waiting in orbit as Commander Trill and his commandos attempted to get Shanhara first. However when Trill realised he was fighting a losing battle against Aric, he called in reinforcements. Xylem then ordered the entire Vine fleet to attack Earth but they were destroyed before they could reach their target by Gafti wearing the Manowar armour. It appears Admiral Xylem was killed along with his crew.

issue_credits.name: Prelude to Planet Death, Part Two of Two
Prelude to Planet Death, Part One of Two

issues_died_in.name: Prelude to Planet Death, Part Two of Two

name: Admiral Xylem

deck: Commander Trill is a member of the alien race The Vine. He serves under Admiral Xylem and is the arch nemesis of X-O Manowar.
description:
Origin

Commander Trill was part of The Vine army force that kidnapped Aric of Dacia, Gafti and other Visigoths from their homeland to be enslaved on the Vine mother ship. During an attempted escape by the slaves, Aric took out one of Trill's eyes.

Creation

Commander Trill was created by writer Robert Venditti and artist Cary Nord. He first appeared in "Blades and Open Fields" in 2012.

Major Story Arcs

Commander Trill has had a personal vendetta against Aric since the Visigoth took out one of his eyes. It transpires Trill is also consumed with rage that Shanhara did not choose him. Whilst leading his X-O Commandos to retrieve Shanahara, Trill and his men ar defeated by Aric. Trill then uses Gafti as a bargaining chip to get the armour of Aric. However Aric soon retrieves Shanhara and brutally beats Trill before he manages to escape.

She was directly responsible for the change of Garfield Logan into Beast Boy, and was then directed to find out exactly how his powers worked though it seems that she never managed to accomplish that task. She seems to be on similar standing with Omen in hierarchy though she's only been featured in a single issue.

deck: Rot was the offspring of Thanos and Death.
description:
Origin

Despite Thanos' infatuation for Death, she had always kept his distance from him and Thanos was certain that he had never been intimate with her. However after his death in the Final Threat story arc, Thanos was finally united with his love, and in Death's realm their energies merged. It was out of this union that Rot, an entity, half of abstract heritage, and half of eternal heritage, was born.

Creation

Rot was created by Steve Englehart and Jorge Santamaria and first appeared in Celestial Quest #2. He wasn't properly introduced into #5 however.

Major Story Arcs

Celestial Quest

At first, Death was unaware of her child's presence- referring to him as a speck. But his power increased to the point that when Thanos was tasked by Death to kill Rot. Thanos not only gleefully agreed, but was disgusted that he had actually created life, and annoyed that he didn't remember being intimate with Death.

Soon after, Thanos killed Rot with a blast so powerful, it was said to make the universe scream.

Powers and Abilities

Being the son of Abstract entity and Skyfather-level being, Rot probably had the capacity to develop vast powers on the level of his parents, including Matter and Reality altering powers, enhanced physical abilities, blasts and other powers far above the scope of most super-humans. He seemed to have no fixed form, and almost acted like a force of nature. He was slowly eating away at the universe, destroying it, and leaving various Avengers catatonic just by touching them. At the time of his death, his power was already such that his mother tasked his father to kill him, and the very scope of the blast Thanos used to dispatch his son indicates that he was a valid threat. Rot, being the son of the Embodiment of Death and the Avatar of Death, would have almost certainly been immortal if it wasn't for his untimely demise. However, the power of his parents means its possible he may return one day.
name: Rot

deck: One of the Boar Brothers, a genetically altered boar created by Bruce Banner.
description:
Origin

In an effort to understand and recreate the accident that created the Hulk, Bruce Banner began experimenting by irradiating various animals with gamma radiation. Amongst those animals he experimented on was 27 and his brother 26, a pair of boars so named because they were the 26th and 27th experiments. 27 was granted advanced intelligence and strength by this exposure to radiation. He and his brother became devoted to serving Banner. 

Creation

27 was created by Jason Aaron and Marc Silvestri. 

Major Story Arcs

Hulk Asunder 

27 and his brother are sent by their "father" to scour the island for possible test subjects. Failing in this they are sent after the Hulk, who has retreated to the Moloid caves. 27 and his brother attack the Moloids, kidnapping the children of the tribe. This draws Hulk to them, and the brothers engage in a fierce battle with the Hulk, who beats them severely. The fight is abruptly ended when 26 plunges through a hole in the Earth's crust that the Hulk had created in the midst of the fight. 27 pauses to mock the Hulk before allowing himself to fall through the hole to be with his brother. He survives the fall, but has been severely wounded by the fight and the fall. His fate is unknown, but he is presumed dead. 

Powers and Abilities

Due to his irradiation, 27 is larger than an average boar, and capable of walking bipedally, as well as speaking and understanding English. Both his strength and his durability are greatly enhanced, and he also possesses enhanced intelligence, though his intelligence is not greatly enhanced when compared to a human.

volume_credits.name: The Incredible Hulk By Jason Aaron

deck: Teenage secret agent
description:
Origin

Nine year old Joe is agent Joe 90.

Creation

Joe 90 was conceived by Gerry Anderson as the star of his latest puppet show following the success of Captain Scarlet and the Mysterons. The TV series first aired on 29th September 1968 with Joe's voice provided by child actor Len Jones. On the week of 18th January 1969 Anderson's Century 21 Publications launched a tie-in comic, Joe 90 Top Secret.
name: Joe 90

deck: Madam Sharley is a shortfin mako shark mermaid. She's the owner of the Mermaid Cafe in Fish-Man island and a renowned fortune-teller.
description:
Origin

Creation

Madam Sharley (マダム・シャーリー, Madamu Shārī) is a supporting character from the One Piece series by Eiichiro Oda. The series first began serialization in Shueisha's Weekly Shōnen Jump on August 4, 1997. She first appeared during the Fish-Man island Arc that began in Volume 61.

Her first anime appearance was in One Piece Vol. 62, CH. 610 "Fortune-Teller Madame Sharley" and

Sharley's name was often written originally in the Japanese publication as "Shyarly", as seen on Ch. 610 (Pg. 8 Panel 2). Both FUNimation and VIZ Media romanized her name as Sharley.

There was originally a continuity error in the Weekly Shōnen Jump publication of One Piece Ch. 544. She was illustrated in a flashback as a young woman, but this would have made her older than thirty years of age in the current time line. In series, mermaids can split their legs to walk once they are thirty years old. Oda would later correct this in Volume 65's release by redrawing Sharley as much younger.

Major Story Arcs

Powers & Abilities

Other Media

Anime

One Piece

Her first anime appearance was in One Piece - Episode 529 "The Fish-Man Island Will Be Annihilated?! Sharley's Prophecy!". Her character in the Japanese series is voiced by Romi Paku, and the U.S. dub produced by FUNimation has yet to announce any casting information.
name: Madam Sharley

After the discovery of his achievements, S.H.I.E.L.D. moves him from South America to the Commando Helicarrier.

deck: The legendary Ghost-Finder and Supernatural Detective by William Hope Hodgson. He usually gets called in to investigate allegedly supernatural cases.
description:
The protagonist of eight stories published between 1910 and 1912, Carnacki relates his cases and adventures to his four friends (the author included among them) at his flat in Cheyne Walk, Chelsea.

He is usually called upon by various people to help them with seemingly supernatural problems. But while a case might seem to have it's roots in the realm of the paranormal at the start, some (as he investigates further) have more human causes by the end.

For the problems that have actual supernatural causes, Carnacki usually comes equipped with both items of his own invention (like the Electric Pentacle) and a vast knowledge of ancient texts, rituals, and spells to combat any hostile phantoms. Key among them being the Sigsand Manuscript, an ancient text/tome that seems to have many of the needed incantations, spells and other rituals in it's pages.

Carnacki has appeared sporadically ever since.

Subsequent Use & Various Media:

  • 427 Cheyne Walk: a collection of stories published in the early 90's about the further adventures of Carnacki. Many of the stories use the various off-hand referrences to other (un-documented) cases as basis for their subject matter.
  • League of Extraordinary Gentlemen: Carnacki is brought in as a member of Mina and Quartermain's League in the early 1900's as shown in the 'Black Dossier'. He helped the group banish an Elder Thing via one of his rituals. Left the group after a harrowing encounter with a spirit that gave him brief glimpses of the future. Taken ill by these visions, he withdraws from further activities. This does not stop him from calling upon some of them later on (Vol. III: Century) to help him (and a group of other occult detectives) to try and make sense of some of his more troubling visions.
  • Carnacki has had at least three crossovers with Holmes in recent years. Two are short stories collected in two seperate books (Shadows Over Baker Street and Gaslight Grimoire) that deal with the two running into each other while they both investigate a mystery. The third is a guest-starring role in 'Sherlock Holmes: The Breath of God' by Guy Adams that deals with the two of them (alongside fellow Occult Detective John Silence) being brought in by Aleister Crowley to help thwart a seeming supernatural attack upon London itself. But are things as they seem??
  • Carnacki has been brought to television only once so far in his history, on an episode of "The Rivals of Sherlock Holmes" in the 70's. He is played by the late Donald Pleasence.

deck: An alien creature who gets the better of the Thing in a brief fight.
description:
Taxtor was a Tekton enslaved by the Skrulls of the planet Kral and used in their gladiatorial games. He was sent by Boss Barker to fight against Thing. Taxtor fought Thing to a draw, using his tail to toss Thing into the air.

Powers and Abilities

Taxtor possesses superhuman strength and a prehensile tail.
name: Taxtor

deck: An alien creature who loses to the Thing in a brief fight.

deck: Detective Len Mico works for the N.Y.P.D. and mainly with his parter detective Phil Jones. He encountered the Werewolf by Night during their investigation of some grusome murder in New York.
description:
Brief History

Len was a somewhat short-tempered detective, but always managed to get the job done. He and his partner detective Jones where at the time investigating a few brutal murders. This let them on the path of Jack Russel, the Werewolf by Night. 
 
Note: The story of the killer and the Werewolf by Night was never finished, so it is unknown what happened to both the detectives and if they solved the murders. Years later however, Jack Russel was part of a U.S. special taskforce in Marvel Zombies, so it is safe to say that the detectives at least managed to clear Jack's name as the killer.

deck: Detective Jones worked for the N.Y.P.D. and mainly with his parter detective Len Mico. He encountered the Werewolf by Night during their investigation of some grusome murder in New York.
description:
Brief History

Phil Jones was a N.Y.P.D. detective and was partnered with detective Mico, a more hot-tempered detective. Phil however always managed to calm him down. At the time of their first appearance, both Phil and Mico where investigating a few brutal murders that had taken place in New York City. This let them on the path of Jack Russel, the Werewolf by Night. 
 
Note: The story of the killer and the Werewolf by Night was never finished, so it is unknown what happened to both the detectives and if they solved the murders. Years later however, Jack Russel was part of a U.S. special taskforce in Marvel Zombies, so it is safe to say that the detectives at least managed to clear Jack's name as the killer.
